tier.item: (79) ... a gde vzjat' esce takuju Alju? Takuju umnuju, gostepriimnuju,
Alju, kotoraja uze sdala-past-pfv kandidatskij minimum, a potom,
soobraziv, cto na svete suscestvuet necto vaznee dissertacij, brosila-
past-pfv rabotu i rodila-past-pfv L'vu Petrovicu srazu dvux prelest-
nyx detej. (Kaverin, V.: Dvuxcasovaja progulka)
340 Alla Paslawska and Arnim von Stechow
`...but where to take such an Alja? Such an intelligent and hospitable
Alja, who had passed the first exams already and then, after having
thought that there were more important things in this world than a
dissertation, gave up her work and bore Lev Petrovich two sweet
children at once.'
(79) ... a gde vzjat' esce takuju Alju? Takuju umnuju, gostepriimnuju,

nyx detej. (Kaverin, V.: Dvuxcasovaja progulka)

thought that there were more important things in this world than a

... a gde vzjat' esce takuju Alju? Takuju umnuju, gostepriimnuju, Alju, kotoraja uze sdala-past-pfv kandidatskij minimum, a potom, soobraziv, cto na svete suscestvuet necto vaznee dissertacij, brosila- past-pfv rabotu i rodila-past-pfv L'vu Petrovicu srazu dvux prelest- nyx detej.
(Kaverin, V.: Dvuxcasovaja progulka)
340 Alla Paslawska and Arnim von Stechow

...but where to take such an Alja? Such an intelligent and hospitable Alja, who had passed the first exams already and then, after having thought that there were more important things in this world than a dissertation, gave up her work and bore Lev Petrovich two sweet children at once.
(80) Na poroge stojala molodaja zenscina v cérnom plat'e. Ocevidno, ona
toropilas'-past-ipfv vyjti k nemu i ploxo pricesalas'-past-pfv.
(K. Paustovskij, quoted from (Maslov, 1987))
`In the door stood a young lady in a black coat. Obviously, she had
come in a hurry and she had combed (her hair) badly.'

toropilas'-past-ipfv vyjti k nemu i ploxo pricesalas'-past-pfv.

(81) ­ Pomilujte, da vy razve verujuscij? - sprosila ja , pamjatuja, cto
sovsem nedavno on sdaval-past-ipfv èkzamen po filosofii . (Krestiny.
"Izvestija")
` ­ Excuse me, but are you a believer? ­ I asked, thinking of the fact
that he had passed his exam in philosophy not long ago.'
(81) ­ Pomilujte, da vy razve verujuscij? - sprosila ja , pamjatuja, cto
sovsem nedavno on sdaval-past-ipfv èkzamen po filosofii . (Krestiny.

­ Pomilujte, da vy razve verujuscij?-sprosila ja , pamjatuja, cto sovsem nedavno on sdaval-past-ipfv èkzamen po filosofii .
(Krestiny. "Izvestija")
­ Excuse me, but are you a believer? ­ I asked, thinking of the fact that he had passed his exam in philosophy not long ago.

tier.item: (82) V xaraktere pojavilis-past-pfv nesvojstvennye emu ran'se certy
resitel'nosti i zestokosti. Tri èpizoda postepenno vospitali-past-pfv v
nëm èti novye cuvstva... (Il'f and Petrov: Dvenadcat' stul'ev)
`In his character there had appeared traits of resoluteness and
harshness which previously were not part of him. Three episodes
had nurtured these new feelings in him.' (Forsyth, 1970, p. 64)
(82) V xaraktere pojavilis-past-pfv nesvojstvennye emu ran'se certy
resitel'nosti i zestokosti. Tri èpizoda postepenno vospitali-past-pfv v
nëm èti novye cuvstva... (Il'f and Petrov: Dvenadcat' stul'ev)
`In his character there had appeared traits of resoluteness and
harshness which previously were not part of him. Three episodes
had nurtured these new feelings in him.' (Forsyth, 1970, p. 64)
V xaraktere pojavilis-past-pfv nesvojstvennye emu ran'se certy resitel'nosti i zestokosti. Tri èpizoda postepenno vospitali-past-pfv v nëm èti novye cuvstva...
(Il'f and Petrov: Dvenadcat' stul'ev)
In his character there had appeared traits of resoluteness and harshness which previously were not part of him. Three episodes had nurtured these new feelings in him.
(Forsyth, 1970, p. 64)

tier.item: (83) Ètot poezd vstretil-pfv gde-to kur'erskij sostav, beguscij na Dal'nij
Vostok, èti vagony videli-ipfv ego pozze, cem rasstalas'-pfv Frosja so
svoim ljubimym celovekom...(Platonov, Fro.)
`Somewhere on its way this train had encountered the express
dashing towards the Far East; these carriages had seen (in English,
we would have to use past perfect continuous here) that express since
the time Frosja had parted with her beloved.... (Forsyth, 1970, p.
(83) Ètot poezd vstretil-pfv gde-to kur'erskij sostav, beguscij na Dal'nij
Vostok, èti vagony videli-ipfv ego pozze, cem rasstalas'-pfv Frosja so
svoim ljubimym celovekom...(Platonov, Fro.)
`Somewhere on its way this train had encountered the express
dashing towards the Far East; these carriages had seen (in English,
we would have to use past perfect continuous here) that express since
the time Frosja had parted with her beloved.... (Forsyth, 1970, p.
Ètot poezd vstretil-pfv gde-to kur'erskij sostav, beguscij na Dal'nij Vostok, èti vagony videli-ipfv ego pozze, cem rasstalas'-pfv Frosja so svoim ljubimym celovekom...
(Platonov, Fro.)

Somewhere on its way this train had encountered the express dashing towards the Far East; these carriages had seen (in English, we would have to use past perfect continuous here) that express since the time Frosja had parted with her beloved.... (Forsyth, 1970, p. 68)

igt.tag-types: L L L+AC T T T M+AC

tier.item: (84) Xodila ona na snosjax, no zakonno: v proslom godu letom priezzal-
past-ipfv Gavrila iz polka, privéz-past-pfv zene pol'skogo sitca, pro-
gostil-past-pfv nedolgo... (Soloxov: Tixij Don.)
`She was pregnant, but it was quite legitimate. Gavrila had come on
leave the previous summer, bringing her some Polish calico, and had
stayed for a short time...
(84) Xodila ona na snosjax, no zakonno: v proslom godu letom priezzal-
past-ipfv Gavrila iz polka, privéz-past-pfv zene pol'skogo sitca, pro-
gostil-past-pfv nedolgo... (Soloxov: Tixij Don.)
`She was pregnant, but it was quite legitimate. Gavrila had come on
leave the previous summer, bringing her some Polish calico, and had
stayed for a short time...
Xodila ona na snosjax, no zakonno: v proslom godu letom priezzal- past-ipfv Gavrila iz polka, privéz-past-pfv zene pol'skogo sitca, pro- gostil-past-pfv nedolgo...
(Soloxov: Tixij Don.)
She was pregnant, but it was quite legitimate. Gavrila had come on leave the previous summer, bringing her some Polish calico, and had stayed for a short time...

tier.item: (85) Ona videla-past-ipfv v okno zatylok Volodi, ego seruju sljapu i seroe
pal'to, kotoroe oni vmeste pokupali-past-ipfv, radujas', cto udalos'-
past-pfv podobrat' v ton i cto vsë èto tak idët Volode. (Nikolaeva:
Bitva v puti.)
`Through the window she saw the back of Voldoya's neck, the grey
hat and coat which they had gone to buy together, and they had
been so glad that they were a good match and suited Volodya so
well.' (Forsyth, 1970: 86)
(85) Ona videla-past-ipfv v okno zatylok Volodi, ego seruju sljapu i seroe
pal'to, kotoroe oni vmeste pokupali-past-ipfv, radujas', cto udalos'-
past-pfv podobrat' v ton i cto vsë èto tak idët Volode. (Nikolaeva:
Bitva v puti.)
`Through the window she saw the back of Voldoya's neck, the grey
hat and coat which they had gone to buy together, and they had
been so glad that they were a good match and suited Volodya so
well.' (Forsyth, 1970: 86)
Ona videla-past-ipfv v okno zatylok Volodi, ego seruju sljapu i seroe pal'to, kotoroe oni vmeste pokupali-past-ipfv, radujas', cto udalos'- past-pfv podobrat' v ton i cto vsë èto tak idët Volode.
(Nikolaeva: Bitva v puti.)
Through the window she saw the back of Voldoya's neck, the grey hat and coat which they had gone to buy together, and they had been so glad that they were a good match and suited Volodya so well.
(Forsyth, 1970: 86)
(86) Da, ja cital-past-ipfv ètu knigu. Ja bral-past-ipfv eë v biblioteke.
`Yes, I have read that book. I had it out of the library.'
(86) Da, ja cital-past-ipfv ètu knigu. Ja bral-past-ipfv eë v biblioteke.
`Yes, I have read that book. I had it out of the library.'
Da, ja cital-past-ipfv ètu knigu. Ja bral-past-ipfv eë v biblioteke.
Yes, I have read that book. I had it out of the library.
(87) Mne budet legce, kogda skazu-pres-pfv emu.
(Forsyth, 1970, p. 135)
`I shall feel better when I have told him.'
`Ich werde mich besser fühlen, wenn ich es ihm gesagt habe.' (Ger-
man)

(88) K tomu vremeni, kogda ty uvidis'-pres-pfv ego, ja uze skazu-pres-pfv
emu.
`By the time you see him I shall already have told him.'
(88) K tomu vremeni, kogda ty uvidis'-pres-pfv ego, ja uze skazu-pres-pfv
emu.
`By the time you see him I shall already have told him.'
K tomu vremeni, kogda ty uvidis'-pres-pfv ego, ja uze skazu-pres-pfv emu.
By the time you see him I shall already have told him.
(89) Katja zapisyvala i govorila: `Srok - dve nedeli. Proctez'-pres-pfv i
prixodi-imp-ipfv snova.' (Nilin: Zestokost')
`Katya registered the book and said: `You get it for two weeks.
When you've read it, come back.' (Forsyth, 1970: 137).
(89) Katja zapisyvala i govorila: `Srok - dve nedeli. Proctez'-pres-pfv i
prixodi-imp-ipfv snova.' (Nilin: Zestokost')
`Katya registered the book and said: `You get it for two weeks.
When you've read it, come back.' (Forsyth, 1970: 137).
Katja zapisyvala i govorila: `Srok-dve nedeli. Proctez'-pres-pfv i prixodi-imp-ipfv snova.'
(Nilin: Zestokost')
Katya registered the book and said:`You get it for two weeks. When you've read it, come back.' (Forsyth, 1970: 137).
(90) Kogda my prisli, on zdal-past-ipfv uze cas. (Forsyth, 1970: 69)
`When we arrived he had already been waiting for an hour.'
(90) Kogda my prisli, on zdal-past-ipfv uze cas. (Forsyth, 1970: 69)
`When we arrived he had already been waiting for an hour.'
Kogda my prisli, on zdal-past-ipfv uze cas.
(Forsyth, 1970: 69)
When we arrived he had already been waiting for an hour.
(91) On zil-past-ipfv tam uze god, kogda otec umer.
`He had been living there for a year when his father died.'
(Forsyth, 1970: 69)
(91) On zil-past-ipfv tam uze god, kogda otec umer.
`He had been living there for a year when his father died.'
(Forsyth, 1970: 69)

He had been living there for a year when his father died.
(Forsyth, 1970: 69)
(92) Vse scitali ego obrazovannym celovekom. On cital-past-ipfv Lenina.
`Everyone took him for a knowledgeable person. He had read
Lenin.'

Lenin.'

(94) Vy uze vstrecalis`-ipfv-past?
`Have you met already?'
(94) Vy uze vstrecalis`-ipfv-past?
`Have you met already?'
Vy uze vstrecalis`-ipfv-past?
Have you met already?

tier.item: uze
(110) Vot tri goda ja prikovana k posteli,
particle already three year-G I (am) confined to bed
zizni, ne
otorvana ot mogu trudit'sja .
kept-apart from life, not can work
`For three years I have been confined to my bed, I have been kept
away from life, I have not been able to work.'

tier.item: cto xocet sejcas
(116) Eé porazilo, Tanja otpravit'
her-D surprised that T. wants now sent
Sincovu pis'mo, kotoroe napisano davnym-davno,
Sincov-D letter, which written-PPP long-ago,
esce
kogda vsé bylo po-drugomu, kogda ona
when everything was different, when she still
ne byla ranena. (Simonov: Poslednee leto)
not was wounded-PPP
`She was surprised that T. wanted to send the letter to S., which had
been written long ago when everything had been different, when
she had not yet been wounded.'

(118) Ja prisel c erez dve nedeli i byl prinjat­PPP kakoj-to devicej so
skosennymi k nosu ot postojannogo vran'ja glazami. (M. Bulgakov,
"Master i Margarita")
`I arrived two weeks later and was received by a certain girl, whose
eyes were squinting at the nose from permanent lying.'
(118) Ja prisel c erez dve nedeli i byl prinjat­PPP kakoj-to devicej so
skosennymi k nosu ot postojannogo vran'ja glazami. (M. Bulgakov,
"Master i Margarita")
`I arrived two weeks later and was received by a certain girl, whose

(M. Bulgakov, "Master i Margarita")
I arrived two weeks later and was received by a certain girl, whose eyes were squinting at the nose from permanent lying.
(119) Kogda my proexali tunnel', okno snova bylo-past otkryto-PPP (=
okno snova otkryli) i v kupe stalo ne tak zarko. (Maslov, 1987: 201)
`When we had passed the tunnel, the window was opened again and
it was not so dark in the compartment anymore.'
(119) Kogda my proexali tunnel', okno snova bylo-past otkryto-PPP (=
okno snova otkryli) i v kupe stalo ne tak zarko. (Maslov, 1987: 201)

it was not so dark in the compartment anymore.'
Kogda my proexali tunnel', okno snova bylo-past otkryto-PPP (= okno snova otkryli) i v kupe stalo ne tak zarko.
When we had passed the tunnel, the window was opened again and it was not so dark in the compartment anymore.
(120) Dver' byla-past zakryta-PPP, kogda ja v pjat' casov proxodil mimo,
no ja ne znaju, kogda ona byla-past zakryta-PPP.
`The door was closed-PPP when I passed nearby, but I don't know
when it was closed-PPP'
